quest.name: In the Footsteps of Bardam the Brave
journal: Hien is ready to undertake the challenge of Bardam's Mettle.

If you are to participate in the Naadam and fight alongside the Mol, you must first be recognized as a warrior of the Steppe. To earn this honor, you will be required to complete a rite of passage involving walking in the footsteps of the legendary hero Bardam and taming a yol. Each member of your party must do this by themselves, of course, and so you shall...though if by pure coincidence some of your fellow adventurers happened to have made the long journey to the Far East, and simply insisted on accompanying you...surely no one would be any the wiser.

â€»Bardam's Mettle can be accessed via the Duty Finder.
At the end of a strange and bewildering journey through Bardam's Mettle, you manage to tame a wild yol in the traditional fashion. Trial complete, you leave to rejoin your comrades.
Lyse emerges from the pass not long after you do, her trial also complete. However, there is still no sign of Hien or Gosetsu...

Suddenly recalling the whistles entrusted to her by Cirina, Lyse brings them forth, handing one to you. With a blow, you summon your respective yols, which circle in the skies above in acknowledgement of your new bond. There can be no doubt: you are now warriors of the Steppe.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: <huff> <puff> This is it! The real trial!

dialogue.name: GOSETSU
dialogue.text: Tread softly. We are for hallowed ground, and the kami are restless...

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: Nothing left but to begin, then.

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: To complete the trial, we must each pass through Bardam's Mettle and tame a yol. How precisely we are to do this, I am not sure, but since countless warriors before us have succeeded, I imagine we'll muddle through somehow...

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: But enough talk! We have a Naadam to win!

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: First the trial, then the Naadam, then Doma, then Ala Mhigo! We'll be back home before you know it!

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: Quite frankly, if I cannot convince a large bird to follow me, then what hope do I have with the Xaela? Or my own countrymen, for that matter.

dialogue.name: GOSETSU
dialogue.text: I have stood upon more battlefields than I can count and lived to tell the tale. No bird will be my downfall!

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: I should've known you'd be the first to make it through.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: I'm assuming you had no trouble? Good, good. I managed somehow, as you may have guessed.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: Looks like Hien and Gosetsu are still in there, though. Nothing for it but to wait, then.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: Oh, right. I've still got those whistles Cirina gave me.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: Here's yours. I suppose we ought to give them a try like she said.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: I think that means we've won them over. That one there is yours, right? The other one is mine. Awww...

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: So that's that, then! We're officially warriors of the Steppe!
